title: Farron Keep — Lever Interaction Collision Exploit

reproduction_steps: Navigate to the lever mechanism in Farron Keep
Position player at the base of the lever geometry
Initiate climb input simultaneously with lever activation
Player model clips onto lever; lever animation carries player upward
Player remains suspended in levitating state post-animation

title: Enemy AI Ledge Pathfinding Failure — Thief NPC Self-Destruction
description: A thief-type enemy NPC in the beginning area executes a backstep animation during combat that carries it off a ledge, resulting in a fatal fall. The AI pathfinding system fails to account for ledge proximity during backstep evasion logic, causing self-destruction. Related issue observed in Elden Ring (see #003), suggesting a systemic AI pathing defect across FromSoftware titles.
reproduction_steps: Locate thief-type enemy NPC near ledge in beginning area
Engage enemy in melee combat
Apply pressure to trigger enemy backstep evasion animation
Enemy backsteps off ledge edge without collision or pathfinding correction
NPC falls to fatal depth — self-destructs

reproduction_steps: Locate Messmer Fire Knight enemy near ledge in endgame area

title: Sanctuary Hills — Merchant NPC and Brahmin Midair Spawn
description: A merchant NPC and their Brahmin companion spawn at an elevated position above the ground geometry outside Sanctuary Hills. Both entities are airborne at spawn with no supporting geometry beneath them. Likely caused by a spawn point placement error or a failure in the ground-snapping logic applied at spawn time.

Observe merchant NPC spawn event outside settlement boundary
Merchant NPC and Brahmin companion appear elevated above ground
Entities are suspended in air with no geometry beneath them at spawn

title: "Nanomachines, Snake!" — Post-Combat NPC Hand Clip + Delayed Mass NPC Death Event
description: Two distinct bugs captured in sequence. (A) After shooting a hostile NPC attacking a friendly, the friendly NPC lowers her weapon hand but her off-hand remains locked in a grip pose, clipping through the hostile NPC's body — suggesting the off-hand animation state did not receive the combat-end signal. (B) Upon entering a nearby building and initiating dialogue with an NPC, that NPC and two others in the same space immediately collapse dead. Two NPCs survive. The deceased NPCs appear to share a designation or faction flag not shared by the survivors, suggesting a state or faction propagation error triggered by the dialogue event or the prior combat sequence.
reproduction_steps: Observe hostile NPC attacking a friendly NPC at Gilman Lumber Mill
Shoot and kill the hostile NPC
Observe friendly NPC — weapon hand lowers, off-hand remains clipping through hostile NPC body
Enter nearby building with multiple NPCs present
Initiate dialogue with the first NPC encountered
First NPC and two others in the room immediately collapse dead
Named NPCs survive — note any designation or faction differences between survivors and deceased

title: "Null Ghoul" — Frozen NPC, Ragdoll Suppression, Melee Positional Teleport
description: A Scorched Wanderer NPC is observed in a static frozen pose holding its sides — no idle animation active. Three sequential defects follow: (A) Shooting the NPC in the head destroys the head geometry but triggers no ragdoll response; the NPC remains in the frozen static pose headless. (B) Applying a melee attack causes the NPC to teleport approximately 10 feet to the left and suspend in the air at eye level, mid-ragdoll pose. (C) The NPC in the suspended state is not interactable and does not resolve — permanent suspension.
reproduction_steps: Locate Scorched Wanderer NPC in frozen static pose holding its sides
Shoot NPC in the head — head geometry is destroyed, no ragdoll triggers
NPC remains in frozen static pose despite head destruction
Apply melee attack to the frozen NPC
NPC teleports approximately 10 feet left and suspends at eye level in mid-ragdoll state
Attempt interaction — NPC is not interactable and remains permanently suspended

title: River Boats Missing Collision — Ghost Geometry
description: Boats present in the river have no collision mesh assigned. Spider-Man passes through them entirely on contact and lands in the water as if the boats are not present. Visually the boats render correctly but are non-solid — classic ghost geometry caused by a missing or unassigned collision layer on the boat assets.
reproduction_steps: Navigate to river area containing visible boats
Web-swing or dive toward a boat in the river
Spider-Man passes through boat geometry entirely on contact
Player lands in water — boat renders visually but has no physical collision response

title: Blackwater Shop — Day/Night Transition LOD & Texture Streaming Failure
description: Entering the Blackwater shop interior during the day-to-night transition while the shop state is flagged as closed causes a texture streaming failure. Interior surfaces fail to load entirely. Exterior LOD pop-in is visible through windows, with absent ground and building assets observable from within the shop. Likely a streaming budget or state-flag conflict triggered by the simultaneous shop-closed and time-transition conditions.
reproduction_steps: Travel to Blackwater shop location
Wait for day-to-night time transition to begin
Enter shop during transition window while shop is in closed state
Observe missing interior textures on entry
Observe exterior LOD pop-in and absent building and ground assets visible from interior

title: Character Levitation Above Chair Geometry — Multiple Locations
description: Multiple characters across multiple locations are observed floating above chair geometry rather than sitting flush with the seat surface. The sitting animation plays correctly but the character's position is offset vertically from the chair mesh. Reproduces consistently across different characters and chair assets, suggesting a systemic issue with the sit anchor point or chair collision bounds in the remaster.
reproduction_steps: Observe any NPC or character entering a seated state at a chair
Sitting animation triggers correctly
Character model is visibly separate from the chair seat surface by several inches to a foot
Reproduces across multiple chair types and locations — clip captures 5 to 6 instances

title: Horse Stuck on Fence Geometry — Extended Physics Resolution Failure
description: Horse becomes lodged on top of fence geometry and the physics system fails to resolve the stuck state. Over approximately two minutes of attempting every available input to dislodge the animal, the horse progressively tilts to approximately 30 degrees nose-down as the physics engine attempts to find a valid ground normal beneath it. The horse remains stuck until an external action resolves the state, suggesting the fence collision bounds create a geometry trap the physics solver cannot escape.
reproduction_steps: Approach fence geometry on horseback
Jump horse onto top of fence
Horse lands on fence and becomes lodged — physics cannot resolve position
Attempt all available inputs to dislodge — horse remains stuck
Horse progressively tilts nose-down approximately 30 degrees as physics solver searches for ground normal
State persists until external resolution

title: Shared Chair Occupation — Two NPCs Assigned Same Seat
description: Two NPC characters are simultaneously assigned the same chair as their destination by the pathing system. Both NPCs execute the sit animation and occupy the same seat position, clipping through each other. Indicates the chair reservation or seat-assignment system failed to mark the seat as occupied before the second NPC claimed it.
reproduction_steps: Observe NPC pathing behavior in a populated area with seating
Two NPCs approach the same chair simultaneously
Both execute sit animation — neither is rerouted to an alternate seat
Both NPCs occupy same chair position, clipping through each other

title: Charles & John Simultaneous Hand Clip + Charles Idle Spit Animation
description: While Charles Smith and John Marston stand in proximity, both characters' idle hand animations begin clipping into their own torsos simultaneously. The synchronized nature of the clipping suggests a shared idle animation state triggered by proximity. Charles then executes a spit idle animation directed at John, which while likely an intentional ambient behavior, compounds the visual breakdown of the scene.
reproduction_steps: Position player as John Marston near Charles Smith in camp
Allow both characters to enter idle state while in close proximity
Both characters' hands begin clipping into their torsos simultaneously
Charles executes spit idle animation onto John
Observe combined visual breakdown of proximity idle system

title: Synchronized Player/NPC Horse Dismount — Notable Emergent Behavior
description: Player and a nearby NPC execute horse dismount animations in perfect synchronization, producing an unintentional choreographed appearance. Classified as notable emergent behavior rather than a defect — the individual dismount animations are functioning correctly, but the coincidental synchronization exposes the lack of any animation desync or timing variance system between player and NPC dismount triggers. Worth logging as an edge case for animation system review.
reproduction_steps: Ride horse in proximity to NPC also on horseback
Dismount horse
NPC dismounts simultaneously
Both animations play in perfect sync — appears choreographed
Note: individual animations function correctly — synchronization is coincidental
video_text: NPC and player dismount simultaneously, appears choreographed

title: Horse Traverses Large Water Hole With Zero Physics Response
description: A horse at full gallop traverses a large water-filled hole (approximately 12 feet wide, 8 feet deep, with normally sloping edges) with no reduction in speed, momentum, or friction response. The horse passes through as if the water and terrain depression have no physical properties. Expected behavior would include speed reduction, splash effects, and momentum loss. Suggests the water volume or terrain depression lacks a physics trigger, or the horse physics layer is not interacting with it.
reproduction_steps: Locate large water-filled depression in terrain during open world exploration
Bring horse to full gallop toward the water hole
Horse enters and exits the water hole at full speed
No speed reduction, momentum loss, friction response, or splash effects observed
Horse behaves as if water hole geometry is not present

title: Depth Sorting Artifact Between Overlapping Light Bulbs
description: When multiple light bulb assets overlap in the scene, the depth sorting system fails to correctly resolve draw order. Background bulbs alternate between being correctly occluded, incorrectly drawn in front of foreground bulbs, and rapidly flickering between both states. This is a classic depth sorting or z-fighting artifact caused by insufficient z-buffer precision or incorrect render queue ordering for overlapping transparent or emissive geometry.
reproduction_steps: Locate scene with multiple overlapping or closely positioned light bulb assets
Observe light bulbs from a position where multiple bulbs overlap in screen space
Background bulbs flicker between occluded and incorrectly drawn-in-front states
Flickering alternates rapidly between correct and incorrect draw order

The rock visually appears normal. The launch force and opposite trajectories suggest either an invisible trigger volume with an upward force component is misplaced at this location, or a collision normal on the rock mesh is oriented incorrectly upward, converting horizontal momentum into vertical launch force.
reproduction_steps: Locate specific rock geometry in desert area during open world exploration
Approach rock at gallop speed
Horse and player are launched approximately 6.5 feet airborne in opposite directions on contact
Rock appears visually normal — no visible trigger or ramp geometry present
Note exact location for reproduction — behavior is location-specific

title: Air Vent Shaft — Power Slam Geometry Warp & Piston Platform Clip
description: Two related collision failures at the same geometry location above an air vent shaft. (A) Performing a power slam directly above the vent triggers a positional warp approximately 15 feet from the point of impact — the player is teleported laterally on landing with no environmental explanation. (B) Standing idle in the same spot causes the player to gradually clip through the floor into the vent shaft below, driven by the piston platform collision pushing the player through solid geometry. Once inside the shaft the player is movement-locked until crouch input is used to restore navigation. Both bugs share a root location, suggesting a collision mesh gap or incorrect collision layer assignment on the vent cover geometry.
reproduction_steps: Locate air vent shaft in the specified level area
Position player directly above vent geometry
Path A — Execute power slam input: player warps approximately 15 feet laterally on landing
Path B — Stand idle above same vent: piston platform collision gradually pushes player through floor into vent shaft
Player enters vent shaft in movement-locked state
Input crouch to restore movement navigation inside the shaft

The result is a prop visibly held and manipulated by an invisible entity — the prop moves through the correct animation path with no visible character driving it. Likely a model streaming or LOD failure causing the mesh to not load while the animation skeleton and prop attachment point remain active.
reproduction_steps: Progress to the Johnny Silverhand flashback sequence in 'Never Fade Away'
Enter the Afterlife
Observe NPC near prop interaction point
NPC model is absent — prop visibly animates in held position with no character attached
Prop continues through full animation path driven by invisible skeleton
